alert.note: Alert for Baker; Bradford; Central Marion; Eastern Alachua; Union; Western Alachua; Western Marion (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 29 at 2:38AM EDT until further notice by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Portions of northeast Florida, including Baker, Bradford, Central Marion, Eastern Alachua, Union, Western Alachua and Western Marion counties. * WHEN...Through late tonight. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Area creeks and streams are running high and could flood with more heavy rain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - The National Weather Service in Jacksonville has issued a Flood Watch for portions of inland northeast Florida where days of heavy rainfall have created saturated grounds and river rises. Additional rounds of heavy rainfall today with localized amounts of 2 to 4 inches are likely and may lead to flooding in the flood watch area. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Baker; Bradford; Central Marion; Eastern Alachua; Union; Western Alachua; Western Marion
